brandContext.motionPhilosophy: Motion gives interfaces soul. Every animation should feel as effortless as dandelion seeds drifting on a gentle breeze - natural, unhurried, and gracefully purposeful.

principles.name: Effortless Flow (Fluxo sem Esforco)
principles.description: Animations should feel as natural as dandelion seeds drifting in a gentle breeze. No sudden starts or jarring stops - everything flows with organic ease.
principles.rationale: Embodies the anti-hustle philosophy: movement should feel light and sustainable, never rushed or stressful.
principles.do: Use gentle ease-out curves for entering elements, letting them settle naturally into place like seeds landing softly.
principles.dont: Never use linear timing or aggressive ease-in curves that make elements feel pushed or forced.

principles.name: Purposeful Presence (Presenca com Proposito)
principles.description: Every animation serves a purpose - guiding attention, confirming actions, or establishing relationships. Decorative motion is avoided.
principles.rationale: Reflects the Mentora Sabia archetype: wise, intentional, never wasteful. Like a mentor who speaks only when there is something meaningful to say.
principles.do: Animate state changes that help users understand what happened and what to do next.
principles.dont: Add animation purely for visual interest or to make things feel 'dynamic'. Avoid gratuitous loops or bouncing.

principles.name: Gentle Invitation (Convite Gentil)
principles.description: Interactive elements invite engagement through subtle, welcoming motion rather than demanding attention with aggressive effects.
principles.rationale: Mirrors the brand voice: 'acolhe e chacoalha no mesmo paragrafo' - warmly embraces first, then motivates. Never aggressive.
principles.do: Use soft shadows lifting, gentle color shifts, and modest scale changes on hover to suggest interactivity.
principles.dont: Implement flashy hover effects, pulsing buttons, or animations that scream for attention.

principles.name: Breathing Space (Espaco para Respirar)
principles.description: Motion should create rhythm and pause, like the natural cadence of breathing. Elements need time to settle before the next change.
principles.rationale: Core to the brand promise: 'Empreenda com leveza'. The interface should feel spacious and calm, never overwhelming.
principles.do: Stagger entrance animations to create rhythm. Allow completed animations to rest before initiating new ones.
principles.dont: Trigger multiple simultaneous animations that compete for attention. Avoid frantic, back-to-back transitions.

principles.name: Organic Curves (Curvas Organicas)
principles.description: Motion paths and easing curves follow organic, natural patterns - never mechanical or robotic. Think of how seeds drift, not how machines move.
principles.rationale: The dandelion symbolism demands organic, natural motion. Mechanical precision contradicts the freedom narrative.
principles.do: Use custom bezier curves that mimic natural deceleration. Consider slight overshoot for settling motion.
principles.dont: Use perfectly linear motion or standard CSS ease that feels generic. Avoid sharp direction changes.

principles.name: Trustworthy Predictability (Previsibilidade Confiavel)
principles.description: Similar interactions produce similar animations. Users should quickly develop an intuitive sense of how the interface moves.
principles.rationale: Builds the 'confianca' emotion. Like a wise mentor, the interface is reliable and consistent in its responses.
principles.do: Maintain consistent duration and easing for similar interaction types across the entire product.
principles.dont: Vary animation styles inconsistently or surprise users with unexpected motion behaviors.

principles.name: Transformation Moments (Momentos de Transformacao)
principles.description: Key state changes - completing a form, achieving a goal, unlocking access - deserve slightly more elaborate, celebratory motion.
principles.rationale: The brand is about transformation. These milestone animations acknowledge the user's journey without being excessive.
principles.do: Use the emphasized easing and slightly longer durations for success states and key completions.
principles.dont: Make celebration animations so dramatic they feel like a carnival. Keep it professional and warm.

instant.usage: Immediate state changes where animation would feel sluggish (focus rings, selection highlights)
instant.brandRationale: Some responses need to be immediate to feel trustworthy

fast.usage: Micro-interactions: button hover, checkbox check, icon transitions, color changes
fast.brandRationale: Quick but perceptible - shows responsiveness without being jarring

normal.usage: Standard transitions: dropdown open, tooltip appear, input focus, tab switch
normal.brandRationale: The natural rhythm of the interface - like a calm breath

slow.usage: Emphasis moments: modal enter, card expand, menu reveal, content reveal on scroll
slow.brandRationale: Gives weight to meaningful changes - like a dandelion seed settling

slower.usage: Complex animations: page transitions, multi-step reveals, transformation moments
slower.brandRationale: Major transformations deserve unhurried, graceful motion

deliberate.usage: Celebration moments: success states, completion animations, key milestones
deliberate.brandRationale: Acknowledges achievement with proper presence - never rushed

out.usage: PRIMARY - Elements entering view, appearing, opening. Most common easing.
out.brandRationale: Fast start that settles gently - like a seed catching air and floating down. The default 'Seja Livre' motion feel.

in.usage: Elements exiting, closing, disappearing. Accelerates as it leaves.
in.brandRationale: Gentle start that accelerates away - like a seed lifting off, gaining momentum as wind carries it.

inOut.usage: Elements moving from one state to another while remaining visible (sliding, repositioning).
inOut.brandRationale: Smooth journey with gentle acceleration and deceleration - continuous flow like seeds drifting laterally.

emphasized.usage: Important moments: success confirmations, transformations, celebrations. Has slight overshoot.
emphasized.brandRationale: A gentle overshoot that settles back - like a seed overshooting its landing spot and floating back. Conveys completion with warmth.

spring.usage: SPARINGLY - Toggle switches, playful elements. Use restraint - not the default brand feel.
spring.brandRationale: Reserved for moments that benefit from a touch of organic bounce. The brand is professional first.

linear.usage: ONLY for properties where easing looks wrong: opacity fades, color transitions, progress bars.
linear.brandRationale: Mechanical and un-organic - use only when easing would create visual artifacts.

hover.css: transition: transform var(--duration-fast) var(--ease-out), box-shadow var(--duration-fast) var(--ease-out), background-color var(--duration-fast) var(--ease-out);

press.shadowChange: Return to shadow-sm with inner shadow hint
press.css: transform: translateY(0px) scale(0.98); box-shadow: var(--shadow-sm), var(--shadow-inner);

focus.effect: Focus ring appears immediately for accessibility

focus.css: transition: border-color var(--duration-fast) var(--ease-out), box-shadow var(--duration-fast) var(--ease-out);

blur.note: Slightly longer exit to feel unhurried

labelFloat.css: transition: transform var(--duration-normal) var(--ease-out), font-size var(--duration-normal) var(--ease-out);

switch.css: transition: transform var(--duration-normal) var(--ease-spring), background-color var(--duration-fast) var(--ease-out);
switch.note: One of few places where spring easing is appropriate

check.enterAnimation: Scale from 0.8 to 1, checkmark draws in

uncheck.note: Reverse of check - slightly faster feeling

select.innerDotAnimation: Scale from 0 to 1 with slight overshoot
select.css: @keyframes radio-select { 0% { transform: scale(0); } 70% { transform: scale(1.1); } 100% { transform: scale(1); } }

hover.underlineAnimation: Underline opacity increases or slides in
hover.css: transition: color var(--duration-fast) var(--ease-out); text-decoration: underline; text-underline-offset: 3px;
transition: transform var(--duration-normal) var(--ease-out), box-shadow var(--duration-normal) var(--ease-out);
hover.note: Gentle lift like a seed beginning to float - inviting, not demanding

success.iconAnimation: Checkmark fades and scales in with ease-emphasized
success.css: @keyframes validation-success { 0% { opacity: 0; transform: scale(0.8); } 100% { opacity: 1; transform: scale(1); } }

error.iconAnimation: Error icon fades in, optional subtle shake
error.shakeAnimation: @keyframes gentle-shake { 0%, 100% { transform: translateX(0); } 25% { transform: translateX(-2px); } 75% { transform: translateX(2px); } }
error.note: Shake is very subtle - just 2px movement, not aggressive

messageEnter.css: @keyframes message-enter { from { opacity: 0; transform: translateY(-8px); } to { opacity: 1; transform: translateY(0); } }

enter.css: @keyframes modal-enter { from { opacity: 0; transform: scale(0.95) translateY(10px); } to { opacity: 1; transform: scale(1) translateY(0); } }

exit.note: Exit is slightly faster - content leaves first, then backdrop fades

open.css: @keyframes dropdown-open { from { opacity: 0; transform: scaleY(0.95) translateY(-4px); } to { opacity: 1; transform: scaleY(1) translateY(0); } }

close.note: Faster close feels more responsive to user intent

expand.css: @keyframes accordion-expand { from { max-height: 0; opacity: 0; } to { max-height: var(--content-height); opacity: 1; } }

collapse.note: Content fades first, then height collapses

enter.css: @keyframes toast-enter { from { opacity: 0; transform: translateY(16px) scale(0.95); } to { opacity: 1; transform: translateY(0) scale(1); } }

exit.note: Floats up and away, like a seed lifting off

autoProgress.note: Progress bar shrinks linearly showing time remaining

indicator.technique: Active indicator slides to new tab position
indicator.css: transition: transform var(--duration-normal) var(--ease-inOut), width var(--duration-normal) var(--ease-inOut);

panelSwitch.technique: Quick crossfade between panels - no sliding
panelSwitch.note: Sliding would be too much motion; simple crossfade is cleaner

enter.css: @keyframes page-enter { from { opacity: 0; transform: translateY(20px); } to { opacity: 1; transform: translateY(0); } }
enter.note: Content rises gently into view, like seeds settling

exit.note: Simple fade out - no motion to avoid complexity

menuOpen.technique: Slides in from right or top

menuItems.itemAnimation: @keyframes menu-item-enter { from { opacity: 0; transform: translateX(20px); } to { opacity: 1; transform: translateX(0); } }
menuItems.note: Creates a 'breathing' rhythm as items appear

idle.note: Very subtle - only 4px movement. Like a seed hovering on a gentle breeze.

hover.pauseFloat: Hover pauses the idle float animation

attention.triggerCondition: Only after 30s on page if user hasn't scrolled

enter.note: Arrives with gentle overshoot - welcoming, not aggressive

skeleton.css: background: linear-gradient(90deg, var(--color-neutral-100) 0%, var(--color-neutral-50) 50%, var(--color-neutral-100) 100%); background-size: 200% 100%; animation: skeleton-shimmer 1800ms var(--ease-inOut) infinite;
skeleton.note: Slow, gentle wave - feels like calm breathing, not anxious waiting

spinner.usage: Use sparingly - skeletons preferred for content loading
spinner.easing: linear for rotation, ease-inOut for pulse
spinner.keyframes: @keyframes spinner-rotate { from { transform: rotate(0deg); } to { transform: rotate(360deg); } }
spinner.design: Simple circle with brand colors - navy stroke with gold accent segment
spinner.note: If using spinner, keep it simple and on-brand

progressBar.animation: Smooth width transition with subtle shimmer

contentShimmer.usage: Applied to text placeholders while loading

imageLazyLoad.note: No blur-up technique - simple fade is cleaner and more professional

defaultAnimation.css: @keyframes scroll-reveal { from { opacity: 0; transform: translateY(30px); } to { opacity: 1; transform: translateY(0); } }

stagger.maxItems: 5 items max in a stagger group
stagger.note: Creates the breathing rhythm - like seeds releasing one by one

parallax.usage: MINIMAL - only for hero backgrounds if at all
parallax.recommendation: Avoid parallax - it contradicts the calm, grounded brand feel

ifUsed.note: Seja Livre is grounded and trustworthy - parallax can feel gimmicky

header.behavior: Slides up to hide on scroll down, reveals on scroll up

cta.behavior: Fades in after scrolling past hero section

smoothScroll.note: Native smooth scroll - no JS animation needed

reduced_motion.strategy: Respect user preferences completely. Motion should enhance, never exclude.
reduced_motion.philosophy: For users who need reduced motion, we remove decorative animations but preserve functional feedback. The brand experience remains warm and professional.
reduce: Modal transitions (instant appear, slight opacity fade)
Dropdown animations (instant open with subtle fade)
Toast notifications (instant appear, fade out only)

testing.howToTest: Enable 'Reduce motion' in OS accessibility settings
testing.macOS: System Preferences > Accessibility > Display > Reduce motion
testing.windows: Settings > Ease of Access > Display > Show animations in Windows

reduced_motion.note: This is not optional - reduced motion support is a core accessibility requirement.

dandelion_motifs.philosophy: The dandelion symbolism can inspire motion design without being literal. We capture the essence - lightness, natural drift, organic settling - not the image.

applications.contentReveal: Elements rise gently like seeds catching air, then settle naturally
applications.exitAnimations: Elements float away, gaining momentum - like seeds lifting off
applications.hoverStates: Gentle lift as if beginning to float - invitation, not demand
applications.successMoments: Slight overshoot that settles back - seeds finding their landing spot
applications.loadingState: Slow, rhythmic shimmer - like seeds swaying in a gentle breeze

avoidLiteral: Anything that looks like a dandelion

beforeShipping: Test all animations at 60fps - no jank or dropped frames
Verify reduced-motion support is complete and tested
Ensure focus states are visible and meet WCAG requirements
Check animation timing feels right at different screen sizes
Validate that no animation blocks user interaction
Test on actual devices, not just browser DevTools
Verify loading states don't cause layout shift (CLS)
Ensure animations don't cause accessibility issues (vestibular disorders)
brandAlignment: Does this animation feel effortless, not effortful?
Is the motion gentle and inviting, not demanding?
Does it enhance understanding or is it decorative?
Would removing this animation hurt the experience?
Does it feel like Seja Livre - professional but warm?
Is it consistent with other animations in the system?
